subject: Physical Fitness
title: Shin Splints
description: A 1-minute de-risking session on Shin Splints.

hook.text: New runners know this pain well â€” aching shins that throb with every step. It's the classic beginner injury.

buildup.text: Medial tibial stress syndrome â€” shin splints â€” affects up to 35% of runners, especially new ones.

discovery.text: It's caused by repeated stress on the shinbone and the tissues attaching muscles to the bone's surface.

twist.text: The real cause is usually doing too much, too soon. The bone remodels slowly and can't keep pace with training.

climax.text: Gradual progression and calf strengthening prevent most cases. Running surface matters less than load management.

punchline.text: Shin splints are bones asking for patience. Build mileage slowly and they fade.

quiz.question: What is the primary cause of shin splints in new runners?
options: Increasing training volume faster than bone can adapt
